SEARCH
Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.game

Class Score

java.lang.Object
com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.game.Score
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Score extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a player's score in the game.

The Score class encapsulates details about a player's performance on a specific map, including the score achieved, the map's index and name, and the date when the score was recorded. This class implements Serializable to allow scores to be saved and loaded for persistence across game sessions.

Each Score object is tied to a specific map and contains:
  • The numerical score achieved by the player.
  • The index of the map where the score was achieved.
  • The name of the map corresponding to the index.
  • The date the score was recorded.

    • Score

      public Score(int score, int map_index, String map_name, String date)
      Constructs a new Score object.
      Parameters:
      score - The player's score achieved on the map.
      map_index - The index of the map where the score was achieved.
      map_name - The name of the map corresponding to the map index.
      date - The date when the score was recorded, in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts the Score object to a string representation.

      This method provides a human-readable format of the score details, including the score, map index, map name, and date. Useful for debugging or displaying score information in logs.
